intro: Illecebrum alpinum, commonly known as the Alpine devil's-bit, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, umbrella-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Illecebrum alpinum is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand cold and harsh environmental conditions.
